description: The European White Birch (Betula pendula) is an amazing species of tree. Its graceful white bark, delicate leaves and graceful pendulum-shaped branches truly stands out in any landscape. This species is also highly adaptable, being able to endure dry or wet conditions and soil temperatures ranging from 8 to 21 degrees Celsius. Unlike other birches, its cream-colored bark does not exfoliate, making it a gorgeous year-round accent tree in any landscape. The European White Birch is a desirable species for its flood tolerance, its ability to attract wildlife, and its unique aesthetic.
